ai_page.title: Apply to make change to a council flat - North Somerset - Page
ai_page.body:
Check if you need permission

Some types of developments don’t require planning permission. It is your responsibility as the owner/developer to apply for planning permission when it is required.

If you are uncertain about the need for planning permission, you can apply to us for a Lawful Development Certificate, following which we will send you a formal decision which will confirm if you need to make a planning application or not.

The Planning Portal has prepared tools and advice to make is easier to understand the rules about when planning permission is required.

  • Common projects  - Planning Portal guidance on the building work you have in mind
  • Interactive guides  - visual clarification of the permitted development rules for specific projects
  • Permitted development  - further information about Permitted Development Rights

Confirmation of permitted development

Find out if permitted development rights for your property have been removed.

There is an £100 fee for this service, which you will need to pay when completing the form.

We will respond within 10 working days.

Planning Aid England

Planning Aid England (PAE) provides free, independent, professional planning advice and support to help individuals and communities to engage in the planning system.

This includes online guidance and a limited amount of free email advice which can be accessed via the Planning Aid England - Online Form. In some circumstances PAE may be able to offer additional bespoke support. To find out more visit Planning Aid England

Requests for advice about what we would grant planning permission for should be made using our pre-application advice service.

Practical advice on home improvements

LABC Warranty

With policies underwritten by ‘A’ rated global insurers, you can secure finance more easily and get technical guidance throughout the build to limit the potential for any problems and ensure your reputation is protected. You will benefit from the support of a dedicated Account Manager and Customer Service contact.

Whether you are building homes, large apartment blocks or commercial projects to sell or rent, LABC Warranty have a product designed to protect your project.

A homeowner's guide to the planning process

ai_business_case.letter:
To the CEO,

Based on the recent customer feedback and analysis of our web content related to flat improvement requests, I have identified key areas for enhancement that can significantly improve service efficiency and reduce operational costs.

Customer Persona & Needs:
Our customer, David, exemplifies a typical tenant who is comfortable with digital processes and prefers straightforward, step-by-step guidance for small-scale requests such as installing a handrail or updating a kitchen. His primary concern is to receive timely updates and clarity on the approval process, which influences his overall experience and satisfaction.

Current Feedback & Issues:
David’s feedback indicates that the existing webpage does not directly explain how to request permission for specific flat improvements. He finds the information too generic, with no tailored guidance for small modifications, and is uncertain whether the online forms mentioned are applicable. Additionally, he worries about delays and missing critical updates.

This results in potential user frustration, increased inquiry volume, and inefficient allocation of customer support resources. Moreover, ambiguity may lead tenants to avoid online channels altogether, increasing reliance on costly manual interventions.

Recommendations & Improvements:
To address these issues and optimize our digital service delivery, I recommend developing a clear, step-by-step online guide specifically for tenants requesting minor improvements. This guide should include:

1. **Tailored Step-by-Step Instructions:**  
   - Explicitly confirm whether online forms can be used for small improvements like handrails or kitchen upgrades.  
   - Provide a simple checklist of required documents and photos or plans to upload.  
   - Clarify the typical timeframe for decisions and how tenants will be notified (email/SMS).

2. **Progress Tracking Feature:**  
   - Implement a system that allows tenants to track their application status online.  
   - Send automatic updates at each stage (received, in review, decision made), reducing anxiety and inquiries.

3. **Clear FAQ and Support Links:**  
   - Include concise FAQs addressing common questions about small improvements, permissions, and process timelines.  
   - Provide direct contact options if further clarification is needed.

Impact of these improvements:
- **Enhanced Customer Experience:** Clear, tailored guidance will increase tenant understanding and satisfaction, encouraging continued use of digital services.  
- **Operational Efficiency:** Reducing inbound queries about process steps will free up staff time for more complex cases, lowering service costs.  
- **Faster Turnaround:** Automated updates and progress tracking will streamline decision-making, leading to quicker responses and higher tenant trust.

By implementing these enhancements, we can create a more user-centric online service that aligns with tenant expectations while reducing manual administrative effort, ultimately saving the council money and reinforcing our commitment to efficient public service.

Respectfully,  
[Web Manager Name]  
Usability & Service Improvement Specialist
